Find sources: "Kristy Marmorato" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR Find sources: "Kristy Marmorato" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR ( November 2023 ) November 2023 ( Learn how and when to remove this message ) Incumbent Assumed office January 1, 2024 Assumed office Preceded by Marjorie Velázquez ( 1978-08-18 ) August 18, 1978 (age 46) New York City , New York , U.S. ( 1978-08-18 ) 1978-08-18 (age 46) Republican Gino Marmorato Hostos Community College Campaign website Official website Campaign website Official website Kristy Marmorato ( née Rendino ; born August 18, 1978) [ 1 ] is an American healthcare professional and politician from the neighborhood of Throggs Neck [ 2 ] in The Bronx, New York. Marmorato was elected as the first Republican to be sent from the Bronx to the New York City Council in over 40 years, [ 3 ] beating incumbent Democrat Marjorie Velázquez in the November 7, 2023 general election. [ citation needed ] née Rendino [ ] [ ] [ ] citation needed Early life [ edit ] [ edit ] Marmorato was born, raised, and educated in The Bronx . She grew up in Throggs Neck and as an adult lived in both Pelham Bay and Country Club. She currently resides in Morris Park . [ citation needed ] citation needed Career [ edit ] [ edit ] In her 2023 campaign for the New York City Council , Marmorato ran on a tough-on-crime and anti- upzoning message. [ 4 ] [ 5 ] Marmorato vehemently opposed the construction of 349 housing units (168 of which were affordable housing) in Throggs Neck and criticized Democratic incumbent Marjorie Velazquez for supporting the development. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] Observers at the time attributed Marmorato's victory in the race to Velazquez's support for the affordable housing project. [ 7 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] [ ] After campaigning against upzoning in 2023, she came out in favor of major upzoning reform in 2024, supporting a large-scale rezoning that would allow more housing in New York City. Marmorato said she supported the upzoning reform after fighting "tirelessly" to include less density and add parking minimums. [ 6 ] [ ] Marmorato and fellow Republican Vicky Paladino voted to elect their colleague Joann Ariola from Queens County as their new leader of the Republican caucus in The New York City Council in February 2025. [ 8 ] [ ] Personal life [ edit ] [ edit ] Kristy Marmorato is married with one daughter. [ 9 ] Marmorato is the sister of Michael Rendino . He

is the Chair of the Bronx Republican Party as of 2025. [ 10 ] [ ] [ ] References [ edit ] [ edit ] ^ Kristy Marmorato [@KristyforNY] (August 15, 2023). "Happy Birthday Kristy" ( Tweet ) . Retrieved June 25, 2024 – via Twitter . Hey Friends, my 45th birthday is on 8/18, the greatest gift would be your support. Please consider making a donation to my campaign. She assumed office on January 1, 2024. Her current term ends on January 1, 2026. Marmorato ( Republican Party ) is running for re-election to the New York City Council to represent District 13 . She declared candidacy for the Republican primary scheduled on June 24, 2025 . If you are Kristy Marmorato, click here to fill out Ballotpedia's 2025 Candidate Connection survey . Who fills out Ballotpedia's

Candidate Connection survey? Any candidate running for elected office, at any level, can complete Ballotpedia's Candidate Survey. Completing the survey will update the candidate's Ballotpedia profile, letting voters know who they are and what they stand for. More than 21,000 candidates have taken Ballotpedia's candidate survey since we launched it in 2015. Learn more about the survey here . You can ask Kristy Marmorato to fill out this survey by using the button below. 2023 2023 Kristy Marmorato did not complete Ballotpedia's 2023 Candidate Connection survey.
